item.title: SONiC Community Image Initial Setup
item.author: seisokeii
item.description:
Above image is just for verifying some concepts then build a small Lab QQ

In EVE-NG or GNS3 simulator, running the SONiC KVM image will leave a lot of settings after booting. It’s annoying to pull out a bunch of settings every time you boot a new machine.

In this situation, I would like to automate the solution ( computer science people => lazy), but it seems that I don’t need to use Ansible, pyATS, or Nornir yet. So I use shell script to solve it.

item.title: Open Network Install Environment (ONIE) How to build?
item.author: seisokeii
item.description:
Above images is the machine I used for development, it looks like a 1U N3k XD

Following the previous article ONIE Simple Introduction, let’s briefly share how ONIE is built!

This will be similar to a tutorial, but of course it’s impossible to put company information here~ It’s just a general look at how a network equipment manufacturer makes this thing.

Preparation - Prepare the development environment

Honestly, the development environment is just a standard Linux machine, I use a virtual machine~

item.title: Open Network Install Environment (ONIE) Simple Introduction
item.author: seisokeii
item.description:
Above image is generate by Gemini. I just say that I want a Japanese style ONIE image, and it becomes like this XD

If you have ever used a whitebox switch, you maybe know what Open Network Install Environment is ~ Here is a simple brief introduction to ONIE. The first task during my internship at Edge-core Networks was to make a new device compatible with ONIE, which means making ONIE run on the new device.

item.title: ACS Custom Noise Cancelling Earplugs
item.author: seisokeii
item.description:
I decided to share my experience since there aren’t many people talking about this on internet.

So why did I want custom earplugs? Mainly because my friends often invite me to hardstyle nightclubs and music festivals like Defqon.1, Intents, etc., and eardrums are very fragile. I don’t want to lose my hearing so early QQ

But there’s another reason, which might be the bigger one, that sometimes I need to work on equipment in the network room or server room, and sometimes I stay there for a long time, and the high-frequency fans are super noisy… For these reasons, I wanted to find a way to protect my ears.

item.title: Halo
item.author: seisokeii
item.description:
Opening greeting~ A song suddenly appear in my brain called HALO made by sub zero project, which I really love!

The first post is dedicated to Hugo!

First of all, I have to say that my luck is really terrible… I read many articles on the Internet that said Hugo can be set up in 5 minutes, but it took me a day (more than 20 hours) to get it done before I started writing this post…
